title: Time Taken to Cross the Door

content.content:
I don't get the following example:

[0,0,0,1,2,3,4] with [0,0,1,0,1,1,0]

I would have thought you would get

[1,2,0,3,4,5,6]

because after the first three people, the final four are not making simultaneous demands on the door and will thus go in order.  But the actual answer is

[1,2,0,3,5,6,4]

where the people entering have priority over the people exiting as normal...

The explanation for this is that the door resource is granted to people *waiting* at the same time in accordance with the rules.   AS WE SERVE REQUESTS, TIME ADVANCES -- thus people who were not waiting at the same time originally are waiting at the same time now.
